Michael Schuerig wrote:
> 
> I'm using HSQLDB to run an in-memory and in-process database for
> testing. Currently, I'm doing the setup mostly manually, but would like
> to change that. I've had a look at DbUnit and it appears to be very
> helpful for getting data into an existing DB. However, AFAICT, it
> doesn't provide help for creating the database structure.
> 
> Now I'm looking for an easy way to create the tables in the in-memory
> database that ensures consistency with the production database. The
> latter is managed by HSQLDB in this particular case, too, but that's
> not necessarily so, of course.

I assume you have scripts that automatically create a production 
database, and that those are DDL scripts. Can you not just use those?
